what: APA 7 Style Correlation Table with Shifted Descriptives (Lower Triangle) - Excel Export — apa_cor_table
title: APA 7 Style Correlation Table with Shifted Descriptives (Lower Triangle) - Excel Export — apa_cor_table
text: Creates properly formatted APA 7 style correlation table superscript asterisks proper lower triangle orientation descriptives shifted, exported Excel

title: APA 7 Style Correlation Table with Shifted Descriptives (Lower Triangle) - Excel Export — apa_cor_table
code: apa_cor_table(   data,   filename = NA,   show.conf.interval = TRUE,   show.sig.stars = TRUE,   show.pvalue = TRUE,   landscape = TRUE,   shift.descriptives = FALSE,   cor.methods = NULL )

title: APA 7 Style Correlation Table with Shifted Descriptives (Lower Triangle) - Excel Export — apa_cor_table
text: data Data frame containing variables correlation filename Output filename (end .xlsx) show.conf.interval Whether display confidence intervals show.sig.stars Whether display significance stars show.pvalue Whether display p-values landscape Whether create landscape-oriented output shift.descriptives Whether display descriptives rows bottom cor.methods Named vector specifying correlation methods variables

title: APA 7 Style Correlation Table with Shifted Descriptives (Lower Triangle) - Excel Export — apa_cor_table
APA 7 Style Correlation Table with Shifted Descriptives (Lower Triangle) - Excel Export — apa_cor_table
code: # Basic usage with sample data test_data <- data.frame(   x = rnorm(30),   y = rnorm(30),   z = rnorm(30) ) apa_cor_table(test_data) #>  #>  Descriptive Statistics and Correlations  #>  #>      Variable N  M    SD   1   2   3 #> [1,] 1. x     30 -.17 1.08           #> [2,] 2. y     30 .14  1.09 .11       #> [3,] 3. z     30 .12  1.01 .00 .14   #>  #>  Note. N = number of cases. M = mean. SD = standard deviation.  #> * indicates p < .05. ** indicates p < .01. *** indicates p < .001.  #> $table.title #> [1] "Descriptive Statistics and Correlations" #>  #> $table.body #>      Variable N    M      SD     1     2     3  #> [1,] "1. x"   "30" "-.17" "1.08" ""    ""    "" #> [2,] "2. y"   "30" ".14"  "1.09" ".11" ""    "" #> [3,] "3. z"   "30" ".12"  "1.01" ".00" ".14" "" #>  #> $table.note #> [1] "Note. N = number of cases. M = mean. SD = standard deviation." #>  #> $landscape #> [1] TRUE #>  #> attr(,"class") #> [1] "apa.cor.table"  # With shifted descriptives apa_cor_table(test_data, shift.descriptives = TRUE) #>  #>  Descriptive Statistics and Correlations  #>  #>      Variable 1    2    3    #> [1,] 1. x                    #> [2,] 2. y     .11            #> [3,] 3. z     .00  .14       #> [4,] N        30   30   30   #> [5,] M        -.17 .14  .12  #> [6,] SD       1.08 1.09 1.01 #>  #>  Note. N = number of cases. M = mean. SD = standard deviation.  #> * indicates p < .05. ** indicates p < .01. *** indicates p < .001.  #> $table.title #> [1] "Descriptive Statistics and Correlations" #>  #> $table.body #>      Variable 1      2      3      #> [1,] "1. x"   ""     ""     ""     #> [2,] "2. y"   ".11"  ""     ""     #> [3,] "3. z"   ".00"  ".14"  ""     #> [4,] "N"      "30"   "30"   "30"   #> [5,] "M"      "-.17" ".14"  ".12"  #> [6,] "SD"     "1.08" "1.09" "1.01" #>  #> $table.note #> [1] "Note. N = number of cases. M = mean. SD = standard deviation." #>  #> $landscape #> [1] TRUE #>  #> attr(,"class") #> [1] "apa.cor.table"
